summary: Dual SWR feature fully verified. All 7 metrics visible in MetricsPanel (Power, Peak, SWR Radio, SWR Ant, Amp Volts, Take-Off, Amp Temp). Dual SWR readouts show both radio-end SWR and antenna-end SWR, correctly implementing the 'liar factor' where feedline loss makes SWR appear lower at radio. SWR values respond correctly to config changes (bonding, vehicle, antenna type). Yagi mode also works with dual SWR readouts.

minor.issue: No dedicated health check endpoint exists - returns 404

passed_tests: All 7 metrics visible: Power, Peak, SWR Radio, SWR Ant, Amp Volts, Take-Off, Amp Temp
SWR Antenna >= SWR Radio (liar factor - feedline loss attenuates reflected power)
Toggling bonding off increases both SWR values
Changing vehicle affects SWR values (ground plane effect verified with Jeep)
Changing antenna type affects SWR values (Wilson 1000 mag-mount tested)
Yagi mode works with dual SWR readouts (Radio: 1.6, Antenna: 1.8)
Backend: Equipment API returns antenna types for SWR model (vertical, base-load, mag-mount)
Backend: Vehicles have ground_plane values affecting SWR
Backend: Configurations save/load with bonding setting correctly
critical_code_review_comments: rfEngine.js: calculateSWR (line 448) correctly returns {atRadio, atAntenna} with physics-based impedance model
rfEngine.js: calculateYagiSWR (line 497) also returns dual SWR values
rfEngine.js: applyFeedlineLoss() correctly attenuates gamma for 18ft RG-58 at 27MHz
RFContext.js: Lines 394-404 correctly handle SWR object, extracting swr and swrAtAntenna from result
MetricsPanel.js: Lines 69-98 show dual SWR meters with correct data-testids
MetricsPanel.js: Grid changed to 7 columns (grid-cols-7) to accommodate new SWR Antenna meter
context_for_next_testing_agent: Dual SWR feature verified. calculateSWR and calculateYagiSWR now return {atRadio, atAntenna} objects. MetricsPanel shows both SWR readouts side by side. The 'liar factor' is demonstrated when SWR Antenna > SWR Radio due to feedline loss absorbing reflected power. Tests used: Suburban (good GP) vs Jeep (poor GP), bonding on/off, different antenna types, and Yagi mode.

swr_calculation_model.feedline_loss: 18ft RG-58 at 27MHz, round-trip attenuation applied to Γ

test_scenarios_verified: Initial state: Suburban + 102" whip + bonded → SWR Radio: 1.2, SWR Antenna: 1.2
Poor ground plane: Jeep → SWR increased to 1.4
Mag-mount: Wilson 1000 → SWR Radio: 1.5, SWR Antenna: 1.6
Yagi mode: SWR Radio: 1.6, SWR Antenna: 1.8
